comments.author: edv@jugendhilfe-aktiv.de
comments.creator: edv@jugendhilfe-aktiv.de
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:71.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/71.0

Steps to reproduce:

we use Firefox 68.2.0 ESR  on Windows 2012 RDS. We publish our Application over Parallels RAS / Client. We have an internal Website with Wordpress 5.2. and publish over this site some Document-forms in Word/Excel for working online with them. Our User  open this forms per click and can work with them.  It works fine and properly.  


Actual results:

with the update to 68.3.0 ESR the function like the description above ist missing. We can open the Site, can click the document-forms but no opening, only download. But this download can also not opend in Firefox. I have to go to the Download-folder. 


Expected results:

open the Documentsforms in 68.3.0 ESR for working like in/with 68.2.0 ESR
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:71.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/71.0

Steps to reproduce:

we use Firefox 68.2.0 ESR  on Windows 2012 RDS. We publish our Application over Parallels RAS / Client. We have an internal Website with Wordpress 5.2. and publish over this site some Document-forms in Word/Excel for working online with them. Our User  open this forms per click and can work with them.  It works fine and properly.  


Actual results:

with the update to 68.3.0 ESR the function like the description above ist missing. We can open the Site, can click the document-forms but no opening, only download. But this download can also not opend in Firefox. I have to go to the Download-folder. 


Expected results:

open the Documentsforms in 68.3.0 ESR for working like in/with 68.2.0 ESR

comments.author: florencia.diciocco@softvision.com
comments.creator: florencia.diciocco@softvision.com
comments.raw_text:
Hi Edv, 

I tried opening word/excel files on Windows 10 using firefox 68.3.0 and I had no problem. Could you provide us with an URL to replicate this and maybe credentials? Just to reproduce this bug and see what caused it.

Regards, Flor.
comments.text:
Hi Edv, 

I tried opening word/excel files on Windows 10 using firefox 68.3.0 and I had no problem. Could you provide us with an URL to replicate this and maybe credentials? Just to reproduce this bug and see what caused it.

Regards, Flor.

comments.author: edv@jugendhilfe-aktiv.de
comments.text:
Hi Florencia,

thank you for your work. I was some days in holiday and in this way the my delayed answer. We have a special situation. We are using Parallels Remote Application Server (www.parallels.com) for publishing our Application on Windows Clients or Igel Thin Clients. and only by using the publishing over Parallels RAS we had the problems with Word/Excel in the Firefox Version 68.3.0 ESR. If it is a help or you, we can make a remote sessions with usign Firefoxy in our system. 
Regards Klaus
comments.creator: edv@jugendhilfe-aktiv.de
comments.raw_text:
Hi Florencia,

thank you for your work. I was some days in holiday and in this way the my delayed answer. We have a special situation. We are using Parallels Remote Application Server (www.parallels.com) for publishing our Application on Windows Clients or Igel Thin Clients. and only by using the publishing over Parallels RAS we had the problems with Word/Excel in the Firefox Version 68.3.0 ESR. If it is a help or you, we can make a remote sessions with usign Firefoxy in our system. 
Regards Klaus

Hi Edv,

Thanks for the details. I've chosen a component for this bug in hope that someone with more expertise may look at it. We'll await their answer. If you consider that there's another component that's more proper for this case you may change it.

Regards, Flor.

comments.text:
(In reply to :Gijs (he/him) from comment #4)
> Toshi, I suspect this is a dupe of bug 1602726. Can you confirm? Is there more data you would like that may be possible to gather via remote access (see comment #2) ?

I also believe this is a dupe of bug 1602726, but yes, it would be great if I can have remote access or have someone to run a prototype and collect logs.  Compared to Citrix and Microsoft RemoteApp, a different API may fail with Parallels RAS.
